chapter.title: Database service command-line client
chapter.para:
The trove client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the Database API and its extensions.
This chapter documents trove version 1.4.0.
For help on a specific trove command, enter:

screen.computeroutput: usage: trove [--version] [--debug] [--os-auth-system <auth-system>] [--service-type <service-type>] [--service-name <service-name>] [--bypass-url <bypass-url>] [--database-service-name <database-service-name>] [--endpoint-type <endpoint-type>] [--os-database-api-version <database-api-ver>] [--retries <retries>] [--json] [--insecure] [--os-cacert <ca-certificate>] [--os-cert <certificate>] [--os-key <key>] [--timeout <seconds>] [--os-auth-url OS_AUTH_URL] [--os-domain-id OS_DOMAIN_ID] [--os-domain-name OS_DOMAIN_NAME] [--os-project-id OS_PROJECT_ID] [--os-project-name OS_PROJECT_NAME] [--os-project-domain-id OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID] [--os-project-domain-name OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME] [--os-trust-id OS_TRUST_ID] [--os-user-id OS_USER_ID] [--os-user-name OS_USERNAME] [--os-user-domain-id OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID] [--os-user-domain-name OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME] [--os-password OS_PASSWORD] [--os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name>] [--os-tenant-id <tenant-id>] [--os-auth-token OS_AUTH_TOKEN] [--os-region-name <region-name>] <subcommand> ...

listitem.para: Creates a backup from another backup.
Creates a backup of an instance.
Deletes a backup.
Lists available backups.
Lists available backups for an instance.
Shows details of a backup.
Creates a new cluster.
Deletes a cluster.
Adds more instances to a cluster.
Lists all instances of a cluster.
Lists all the clusters.
Shows details of a cluster.
Drops instances from a cluster.
Attaches a configuration group to an instance.
Creates a configuration group.
Shows the default configuration of an instance.
Deletes a configuration group.
Detaches a configuration group from an instance.
Lists all instances associated with a configuration group.
Lists all configuration groups.
Lists available parameters for a configuration group.
Shows details of a configuration parameter.
Patches a configuration group.
Shows details of a configuration group.
Updates a configuration group.
Creates a new instance.
Creates a database on an instance.
Deletes a database from an instance.
Lists available databases on an instance.
Lists available datastores.
Shows details of a datastore.
Lists available versions for a datastore.
Shows details of a datastore version.
Deletes an instance.
Detaches a replica instance from its replication source.
Ejects a replica source from its set.
Lists available flavors.
Shows details of a flavor.
Lists the limits for a tenant.
Lists all the instances.
Creates metadata in the database for instance <id>.
Deletes metadata for instance <id>.
Replaces metadata value with a new one, this is non-destructive.
Shows all metadata for instance <id>.
Shows metadata entry for key <key> and instance <id>.
Updates metadata, this is destructive.
Promotes a replica to be the new replica source of its set.
Resizes an instance with a new flavor.
Resizes the volume size of an instance.
Restarts an instance.
Enables root for an instance and resets if already exists.
Gets status if root was ever enabled for an instance or cluster.
Creates a security group rule.
Deletes a security group rule.
Lists all security groups.
Lists all rules for a security group.
Shows details of a security group.
Shows details of an instance.
Updates an instance: Edits name, configuration, or replica source.
Creates a user on an instance.
Deletes a user from an instance.
Grants access to a database(s) for a user.
Lists the users for an instance.
Revokes access to a database for a user.
Shows details of a user of an instance.
Shows access details of a user of an instance.
Updates a user's attributes on an instance.
Prints arguments for bash_completion.
Displays help about this program or one of its subcommands.
show program's version number and exit
Print debugging output.
Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_SYSTEM].
Defaults to database for most actions.
Defaults to env[TROVE_SERVICE_NAME].
Defaults to env[TROVE_BYPASS_URL].
Defaults to env[TROVE_DATABASE_SERVICE_NAME].
Defaults to env[TROVE_ENDPOINT_TYPE] or publicURL.
Accepts 1, defaults to env[OS_DATABASE_API_VERSION].
Number of retries.
Output JSON instead of prettyprint. Defaults to env[OS_JSON_OUTPUT].
Explicitly allow client to perform "insecure" TLS (https) requests. The server's certificate will not be verified against any certificate authorities. This option should be used with caution.
Specify a CA bundle file to use in verifying a TLS (https) server certificate. Defaults to env[OS_CACERT].
Defaults to env[OS_CERT].
Defaults to env[OS_KEY].
Set request timeout (in seconds).
Authentication URL
Domain ID to scope to
Domain name to scope to
Project ID to scope to
Project name to scope to
Domain ID containing project
Domain name containing project
Trust ID
User ID
Username
User's domain id
User's domain name
User's password
Tenant to request authorization on. Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_NAME].
Tenant to request authorization on. Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_ID].
Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_TOKEN]
Specify the region to use. Defaults to env[OS_REGION_NAME].

section.title: trove backup-copy
section.para: Creates a backup from another backup.

listitem.para: Name of the backup.
Backup ID of the source backup.
Region where the source backup resides.
An optional description for the backup.

section.title: trove backup-create
section.para: Creates a backup of an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of the backup.
An optional description for the backup.
Optional ID of the parent backup to perform an incremental backup from.

section.title: trove backup-delete
section.para: Deletes a backup.

listitem.para: ID of the backup.

section.title: trove backup-list
section.para: Lists available backups.

listitem.para: Return up to N number of the most recent backups.
Begin displaying the results for IDs greater than the specified marker. When used with --limit, set this to the last ID displayed in the previous run.
Name or ID of the datastore to list backups for.

section.title: trove backup-list-instance
section.para: Lists available backups for an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Return up to N number of the most recent backups.
Begin displaying the results for IDs greater than the specified marker. When used with --limit, set this to the last ID displayed in the previous run.

section.title: trove backup-show
section.para: Shows details of a backup.

listitem.para: ID of the backup.

section.title: trove cluster-create
section.para: Creates a new cluster.

listitem.para: Name of the cluster.
A datastore name or ID.
A datastore version name or ID.

Create an instance for the cluster. Specify multiple times to create multiple instances. Valid options are: flavor=flavor_name_or_id, volume=disk_size_in_GB, nic='net-id=net- uuid,v4-fixed-ip=ip-addr,port-id=port-uuid' (where net-id=network_id, v4-fixed- ip=IPv4r_fixed_address, port-id=port_id), availability_zone=AZ_hint_for_Nova.

section.title: trove cluster-delete
section.para: Deletes a cluster.

listitem.para: ID or name of the cluster.

section.title: trove cluster-grow
section.para: Adds more instances to a cluster.

listitem.para: ID or name of the cluster.
Add an instance to the cluster. Specify multiple times to create multiple instances.

section.title: trove cluster-instances
section.para: Lists all instances of a cluster.

listitem.para: ID or name of the cluster.

section.title: trove cluster-list
section.para: Lists all the clusters.

listitem.para: Limit the number of results displayed.
Begin displaying the results for IDs greater than the specified marker. When used with --limit, set this to the last ID displayed in the previous run.

section.title: trove cluster-show
section.para: Shows details of a cluster.

listitem.para: ID or name of the cluster.

section.title: trove cluster-shrink
section.para: Drops instances from a cluster.

listitem.para: ID or name of the cluster.
Drop instance(s) from the cluster. Specify multiple ids to drop multiple instances.

section.title: trove configuration-attach
section.para: Attaches a configuration group to an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
ID of the configuration group to attach to the instance.

section.title: trove configuration-create
section.para: Creates a configuration group.

listitem.para: Name of the configuration group.
Dictionary of the values to set.
Datastore assigned to the configuration group. Required if default datastore is not configured.
Datastore version ID assigned to the configuration group.
An optional description for the configuration group.

section.title: trove configuration-default
section.para: Shows the default configuration of an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.

section.title: trove configuration-delete
section.para: Deletes a configuration group.

listitem.para: ID of the configuration group.

section.title: trove configuration-detach
section.para: Detaches a configuration group from an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.

section.title: trove configuration-instances
section.para: Lists all instances associated with a configuration group.

listitem.para: ID of the configuration group.

section.title: trove configuration-list
section.para: Lists all configuration groups.

section.title: trove configuration-parameter-list
section.para: Lists available parameters for a configuration group.

listitem.para: Datastore version name or ID assigned to the configuration group.
ID or name of the datastore to list configuration parameters for. Optional if the ID of the datastore_version is provided.

section.title: trove configuration-parameter-show
section.para: Shows details of a configuration parameter.

listitem.para: Datastore version name or ID assigned to the configuration group.
Name of the configuration parameter.
ID or name of the datastore to list configuration parameters for. Optional if the ID of the datastore_version is provided.

section.title: trove configuration-patch
section.para: Patches a configuration group.

listitem.para: ID of the configuration group.
Dictionary of the values to set.

section.title: trove configuration-show
section.para: Shows details of a configuration group.

listitem.para: ID of the configuration group.

section.title: trove configuration-update
section.para: Updates a configuration group.

listitem.para: ID of the configuration group.
Dictionary of the values to set.
Name of the configuration group.
An optional description for the configuration group.

section.title: trove create
section.para: Creates a new instance.

listitem.para: Name of the instance.
Flavor ID or name of the instance.
Size of the instance disk volume in GB. Required when volume support is enabled.
Optional list of databases.
Optional list of users in the form user:password.
A backup ID.
The Zone hint to give to nova.
A datastore name or ID.
A datastore version name or ID.

Create a NIC on the instance. Specify option multiple times to create multiple NICs. net- id: attach NIC to network with this ID (either port-id or net-id must be specified), v4-fixed-ip: IPv4 fixed address for NIC (optional), port-id: attach NIC to port with this ID (either port-id or net-id must be specified).
ID of the configuration group to attach to the instance.
ID or name of an existing instance to replicate from.
Number of replicas to create (defaults to 1).

section.title: trove database-create
section.para: Creates a database on an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of the database.
Optional character set for database.
Optional collation type for database.

section.title: trove database-delete
section.para: Deletes a database from an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of the database.

section.title: trove database-list
section.para: Lists available databases on an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.

section.title: trove datastore-list
section.para: Lists available datastores.

section.title: trove datastore-show
section.para: Shows details of a datastore.

listitem.para: ID of the datastore.

section.title: trove datastore-version-list
section.para: Lists available versions for a datastore.

listitem.para: ID or name of the datastore.

section.title: trove datastore-version-show
section.para: Shows details of a datastore version.

listitem.para: ID or name of the datastore version.
ID or name of the datastore. Optional if the ID of the datastore_version is provided.

section.title: trove delete
section.para: Deletes an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.

section.title: trove detach-replica
section.para: Detaches a replica instance from its replication source.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.

section.title: trove eject-replica-source
section.para: Ejects a replica source from its set.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.

section.title: trove flavor-list
section.para: Lists available flavors.

listitem.para: Type of the datastore. For eg: mysql.
ID of the datastore version.

section.title: trove flavor-show
section.para: Shows details of a flavor.

listitem.para: ID or name of the flavor.

section.title: trove limit-list
section.para: Lists the limits for a tenant.

section.title: trove list
section.para: Lists all the instances.

listitem.para: Limit the number of results displayed.
Begin displaying the results for IDs greater than the specified marker. When used with --limit, set this to the last ID displayed in the previous run.
Include instances that are part of a cluster (default false).

section.title: trove metadata-create
section.para: Creates metadata in the database for instance <id>.

listitem.para: UUID for instance.
Key for assignment.
Value to assign to <key>.

section.title: trove metadata-delete
section.para: Deletes metadata for instance <id>.

listitem.para: UUID for instance.
Metadata key to delete.

section.title: trove metadata-edit
section.para: Replaces metadata value with a new one, this is non-destructive.

listitem.para: UUID for instance.
Key to replace.
New value to assign to <key>.

section.title: trove metadata-list
section.para: Shows all metadata for instance <id>.

listitem.para: UUID for instance.

section.title: trove metadata-show
section.para: Shows metadata entry for key <key> and instance <id>.

listitem.para: UUID for instance.
Key to display.

section.title: trove metadata-update
section.para: Updates metadata, this is destructive.

listitem.para: UUID for instance.
Key to update.
New key.
Value to assign to <newkey>.

section.title: trove promote-to-replica-source
section.para: Promotes a replica to be the new replica source of its set.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.

section.title: trove resize-instance
section.para: Resizes an instance with a new flavor.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
New flavor of the instance.

section.title: trove resize-volume
section.para: Resizes the volume size of an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
New size of the instance disk volume in GB.

section.title: trove restart
section.para: Restarts an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.

section.title: trove root-enable
section.para: Enables root for an instance and resets if already exists.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance or cluster.
Root password to set.

section.title: trove root-show
section.para: Gets status if root was ever enabled for an instance or cluster.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance or cluster.

section.title: trove secgroup-add-rule
section.para: Creates a security group rule.

listitem.para: Security group ID.
CIDR address.

section.title: trove secgroup-delete-rule
section.para: Deletes a security group rule.

listitem.para: Name of security group rule.

section.title: trove secgroup-list
section.para: Lists all security groups.

section.title: trove secgroup-list-rules
section.para: Lists all rules for a security group.

listitem.para: Security group ID.

section.title: trove secgroup-show
section.para: Shows details of a security group.

listitem.para: Security group ID.

section.title: trove show
section.para: Shows details of an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.

section.title: trove update
section.para: Updates an instance: Edits name, configuration, or replica source.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of the instance.
ID of the configuration reference to attach.
Detach the replica instance from its replication source.
Drops the current configuration reference.

section.title: trove user-create
section.para: Creates a user on an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of user.
Password of user.
Optional host of user.
Optional list of databases.

section.title: trove user-delete
section.para: Deletes a user from an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of user.
Optional host of user.

section.title: trove user-grant-access
section.para: Grants access to a database(s) for a user.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of user.
List of databases.
Optional host of user.

section.title: trove user-list
section.para: Lists the users for an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.

section.title: trove user-revoke-access
section.para: Revokes access to a database for a user.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of user.
A single database.
Optional host of user.

section.title: trove user-show
section.para: Shows details of a user of an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of user.
Optional host of user.

section.title: trove user-show-access
section.para: Shows access details of a user of an instance.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of user.
Optional host of user.

section.title: trove user-update-attributes
section.para: Updates a user's attributes on an instance. At least one optional argument must be provided.

listitem.para: ID or name of the instance.
Name of user.
Optional host of user.
Optional new name of user.
Optional new password of user.
Optional new host of user.
